DataElement.preferredName: Brain Perfusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Brain which is an organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning which is protected by the bony cranium. Perfusion is a special type of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) that uses an injected dye in order to see blood flow through tissues. Once executed and carried through to completion the date on which an observation was made or an event occurred is reported.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
A diagnostic procedure to assess the circulatory perfusion of an anatomical location using a magnetic resonance imaging machine.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
